function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate sanitation and wastewater management in residential buildings, leading to the potential spread of viruses through sewage.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Inadequate bathroom infrastructure in residential buildings for preventing virus transmission between occupants during quarantine.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor ventilation leading to increased transmission of viruses","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate distancing measures leading to higher risk of virus transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of hygiene facilities leading to poor sanitation and disease spread","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Viral transmission in buildings and transportation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Environmental contamination in hospitals","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in building activities and layouts due to covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Virus transmission in crowded and poorly ventilated rooms","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate building design for preventing virus spread","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative impact on economic progress","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Development and sharing of data models for infectious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of machine-readable epidemiological quantitative data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate sharing of epidemiological quantitative data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete coverage of epidemiological terms in obo bio-ontologies may hinder interoperability and consistency in data representation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Logical inconsistency due to the link between bfo and gfo in the obo landscape may lead to incompatible temporal regions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of the entity-quality eq model or the adaptation of the resources, events, agents rea model for ontology evaluation may introduce semantic and logical complexities.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The rise of new variants of the virus that may challenge vaccine efficacy","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of compatible logical model for representing and sharing machine-readable patient monitoring and epidemiology surveillance data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear taxonomy structure for infectious diseases ontology","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reuse of ontological terms and models from existing sources","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of owl 2, a dl-based formalism and semantic web standard for knowledge representation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Building a fair resource for health data and research","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Excluded areas may have different socioeconomic variables, potentially biasing the results.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Lack of individual-level socioeconomic data limited detailed study of mechanisms at work.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decrease in testing rate in the most deprived areas signals a deterioration in access to preventive measures.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differential impact of lockdown on sars-cov-2 outcomes in deprived and less deprived areas","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variation in sars-cov-2 outcomes according to population density","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Association between social inequalities and differential exposure to the virus, susceptibility to infection, comorbidities, and access to care.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differential sars-cov-2 incidence, positivity rates, and testing rates in socially deprived areas compared to the least deprived areas.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social gradient in sars-cov-2 incidence and testing likelihood, more pronounced in densely populated socially deprived areas.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Loss of confidence in collective forms of transport","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low return rate of people who completely gave up public transport","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Congestion in public transport during rush hours","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unpredictable factors disrupting sustainable mobility culture","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decreased use of public transport due to fear of contagion","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift to private vehicles and shared mobility services","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Correlation between feeling of safety and feeling of comfort with willingness to use public transport after the epidemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fear of passengers not following hygienic regimes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overcrowding in public transport due to miscalculation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited or resigned use of public transport","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fear of infection with covid-19 leading to a shift from public transport to private vehicles.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Feeling less safe using public transport, affecting attitudes and habits towards public transport use.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Factors affecting comfort and safety in public transport during the pandemic, including fear of other passengers not following hygienic measures and tidiness of the vehicle.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decrease in public transport usage due to covid-19 fear and restrictions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Switch from stationary work and learning to e-learning and online work","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fear of coronavirus infection leading to limited mobility and social lives","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Passengers declare a majority of factors as important for their comfort in public transport, indicating a potential risk of transmission of contagious diseases from other passengers.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Passengers identify other passengers as a key factor in feeling safe in public transport, suggesting a risk of contagious disease transmission from other passengers.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Existence of cctv systems is deemed least important for feeling safe in public transport, potentially indicating a risk of inadequate surveillance for safety and hygiene practices.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"}]}
